image.title: World News Today, Trending World News, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Landslide triggered by rain in Indonesia's Sumatra island kills at least 7 people
item.description: Seven people died after a landslide engulfed a tourist bus in North Sumatra, Indonesia. The bus, along with other vehicles, had been trapped since Wednesday due to torrential rains. Rescuers recovered the bodies and evacuated the injured. This incident follows another landslide earlier in the week that claimed 20 lives in the same region.

item.title: 'I’ve never felt more unhealthy': Author tries Donald Trump's fast-food-based diet for a week
item.description: Gareth Davies, in a dietary experiment, replicated Donald Trump's fast-food-centric eating habits for a week. The results were alarming, with Davies experiencing significant health decline, including weight loss from dehydration, low energy, and difficulty exercising. He described the diet as unhealthy and unsustainable, echoing concerns from RFK Jr. and nutritionist Sam Rice.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Why Judge Subramanian denied bail for Sean 'Diddy' Combs despite $50 million offer from his defence
item.description: Hip-hop mogul Sean "Diddy" Combs remains in federal custody after a judge denied his third bail request. Prosecutors argued Combs obstructed justice by contacting witnesses through banned communication services and used social media to influence public opinion.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Lol wut': Joe Rogan responds to ABC's Kim Williams 'deeply repulsive' remarks on his podcast
item.description: Australian Broadcasting Corporation head Kim Williams criticized Joe Rogan's podcast, calling it "deeply repulsive" and accusing Rogan of exploiting fear and anxiety. Rogan responded dismissively on X. Williams expressed disbelief at Rogan's popularity, particularly in the US, where his interviews, including one with President-elect Trump, have garnered a significant audience.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg joins Donald Trump for dinner at Mar-a-Lago
item.description: Former President Trump and Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg dined at Mar-a-Lago, sparking discussion about their evolving relationship. Zuckerberg, among other business leaders, was invited to discuss Trump's economic plans for his potential second term. This meeting follows Meta's reinstatement of Trump's account after a ban following the January 6th Capitol attack.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Millionaire Shark Tank judge calls Harris a 'complete loser'
item.description: Kevin O'Leary criticized Kamala Harris's presidential bid, calling her a "faulty and broken candidate." He questioned the Democratic Party's decision to bypass a primary contest and appoint her, citing her past failures and inability to articulate a clear vision. O'Leary also highlighted internal doubts within the party about Harris's leadership capabilities and criticized her weak performance on The View.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US sanctions Venezuela security chiefs for crackdown
item.description: The US imposed sanctions on 21 Venezuelan officials, including security and cabinet members, following President Maduro's contested re-election.

item.title: 'He's trying to kill me!': Florida man charged with murder after beating golfer to death
item.description: A horrifying incident unfolded at Sandhill Crane Golf Club near West Palm Beach where a 65-year-old golfer, Brian Hiltebeitel, was fatally attacked. 36-year-old Junior Boucher is accused of bludgeoning Hiltebeitel with golf clubs and choking him in a pond after a chase. Witnesses heard the victim's desperate cries for help.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Baseless, without factual or legal foundation': Israel to appeal to ICC on arrest warrant against Netanyahu
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Violent, UnAmerican': Bomb and swatting threats against Trump's cabinet picks
item.description: Multiple members of Donald Trump's incoming administration were targeted with bomb threats and swatting incidents, including a pipe bomb threat with a pro-Palestinian message. Elise Stefanik, Matt Gaetz, Lori Chavez-DeRemer, and Lee Zeldin were among those targeted. Zeldin confirmed a pipe bomb threat against his family.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: New Ohio law restricts transgender students’ access to school restrooms, 'bathroom bill' sparks outcry
item.description: Ohio Governor Mike DeWine recently signed the "Protect All Students Act," effectively barring transgender students from using school facilities aligning with their gender identity. This "bathroom bill" impacts public and private institutions, sparking both applause for protecting privacy and safety and condemnation for targeting vulnerable youth.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Kamala Harris' step-daughter Ella Emhoff trolled over fashion event appearance: 'Not model material'
item.description: Ella Emhoff, Kamala Harris's stepdaughter, was criticized online after attending a fashion event as social media users commented on her appearance and emotional state. Podcaster Benny Johnson wrote, "I don't think live in the same country as these people." "If the Hunger Games were real," one post read. "These people are broken beyond repair. This woke mind virus is real!" one wrote.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Did Elon Musk pay Kim Kardashian to pose with a Tesla Robot?
item.description: Kim Kardashian recently made several posts featuring Tesla Optimus robot and Tesla cyber truck which the Optimus robot can drive. The posts triggered a backlash that the social media star has gone MAGA though she did not endorse Donald Trump. Her representative told the NYT that she was not paid to make those posts but did not offer any other explanation as to why Kim made those posts.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Donald Trump's special envoy for Ukraine and Russia is Gen Keith Kellogg. Who is he?
item.description: President-elect Donald Trump appointed retired Lt. Gen. Keith Kellogg as special envoy to Ukraine and Russia. Kellogg, a longtime defense advisor to Trump, also served as national security advisor to former Vice President Mike Pence. Trump emphasized achieving peace through strength and ensuring global safety. Kellogg's plan to end the war, which began when Russia invaded the sovereign territory of Ukraine in February 2022, involves freezing the battle lines at their current locations and forcing Kiev and Moscow to sit down at the negotiating table
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Security forces clear Islamabad of Imran Khan's supporters, PTI says 8 party workers killed but protests will go on
item.dc:creator: Omer Farooq

item.title: Is this the list of federal employees whom Elon Musk, Vivek Ramaswamy may fire? Here's the truth
item.description: Several lists of federal employees are going viral with X users claiming that these staff are drawing huge salaries from the government. Elon Musk shared a few and commented on them triggering fear that those individuals will be the first to be fired from their jobs. The Department of Government Efficiency has not put out any list and Vivek Ramaswamy said DOGE's opponent is bureaucracy, not an individual. But Elon Musk sharing posts containing individual names spread panic among employees.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Kamala Harris adviser's explosive claim: Internal polling never showed VP leading Trump
item.description: Kamala Harris's senior campaign adviser, David Plouffe, revealed on a podcast that internal polling never showed Harris ahead of Trump, contradicting public polls. Plouffe admitted the campaign struggled to differentiate Harris from Biden and faced an uphill battle in key demographics. ​“We were behind. I mean, I think it surprised people because there were these public polls that came out in late September, early October, showing us with leads that we never saw,” Plouffe said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Pregnant for 15 months': All you need to know about Nigeria's 'cryptic pregnancy' scam
item.description: A disturbing "cryptic pregnancy" scam in Nigeria preys on infertile women. Scammers posing as medical professionals administer fake treatments, leading victims to believe in phantom pregnancies. The scam culminates in the delivery of trafficked babies, purchased for exorbitant fees. Authorities are working to dismantle these operations and rescue victims.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Chinese man discovers 20-year-old dice lodged in nose after experiencing chronic sneezing
item.description: A 23-year-old Chinese man, Xiaoma, recently discovered the source of his chronic nasal issues: a dice lodged in his nasal cavity for two decades. Doctors successfully removed the partially corroded dice, which Xiaoma believes he inhaled as a toddler. This incident highlights the dangers of foreign objects in nasal passages and the importance of parental vigilance, prompting widespread concern online.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Donald Trump's cabinet picks targeted with bomb threats and 'swatting'
item.description: Several members of President-elect Donald Trump's administration and cabinet picks were targeted with bomb threats and "swatting" incidents late Tuesday and early Wednesday. Trump's spokesperson, Karoline Leavitt, confirmed the threats, emphasizing that such intimidation tactics will not be a deterrent. These incidents follow previous threats and attempted assassination attempts against Trump earlier this year.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
